definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The combination of real objects and pictures showing, and enhance product awareness.
sentences.chinese: 实物与图片结合展示，增强感性认识。

sentences.english: Teachers promote flexible and diverse teaching methods in order to train students' perceptual knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 注重培养学生的感性认识，提倡灵活多样的教学手段。

definition: the objective world (as opposed to empirical observation)
to get a better grasp of sth
practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
direct observation/directly perceived through the senses/intuitive/audiovisual
to know/to recognize/to be familiar with/to get acquainted with sb/knowledge/understanding/awareness/cognition
to proceed from the outside to the inside/to see the essence merely by looking at the superficial appearance
